description: Using Fedora 40
error with service which is running, rebooted and still nothing.
Back in the days the flatpak version was not functional, now everything is there - a dream came true

The other Yubico Authenticator in the SC stops working after a couple times, don't know why. Starts working again after a reboot only to stop again after a while.

 This one works consistently. It shows a different icon in the dock though, when it opens, instead of using the one already pinned there. It would be nice if this could be fixed.
It's great being able to access my one time keys on multiple devices and also having a backup on my second yubikey.

Come on it can't have been such a big change from ubuntu 18.04 to 20.04.
It cannot even detect the yubikey
This is the Yubi Authenticator that actually works. The other one (square icon instead of circle) doesn't even detect my key when it's plugged in. Unfortunate this one is listed as never updated.
Did not see my key, but works after installing pcsc-tools

* QR code scan doesn't work with wayland under gnome 3.38.4. 
* window cannot be resized in the same environment.
summary: It's ok, but it has some bugs

description: Seems to be working ok, if I run into any thing Ill adjust my review.
As of 5.0.5, Yubico Authenticator refuses to work.
It does not do the one thing it is designed to do on Arch linux, only seems to work on Ubuntu based on my testing...

I have not yet used this app properly, but I like the premise a lot, so I am giving it a 4-star rating, but the reason I am writing this review, is because people are saying this app does not work

In order for this application to work, at least on ArchLinux, you need to, and I quote from Arch Wiki:

  Note: After installation, enable pcscd.service

If you do that, it works fine.
This should be the official Ubuntu app for Yubikey. It works perfectly. 5/5!
This one works well.

I am using a Yubikey 5Ci which works great on my iPhone but for some reason it has stopped working on my fedora laptop. I am running the flatpak. I have uninstalled and reinstalled several times. It appears as if I have 0 accounts. It does this to both my yubikeys. Not sure what is wrong.
summary: Does not recognize any accounts on my yubikey

description: This app is normaly awesome unfortunatlly the flatpack version on fedora 35 (silverblue) can see the key however just says "no accounts".
App says there are no accounts on my key. This is not the case.
Go to yubico website and download the appimage instead.
summary: Does not work. Says "No Accounts" when yubikey connected

description: Fedora Silverblue 35 - Key get's recognized, doesn't show my accounts though. When trying to add a new one the button "Add Account" simply does nothing.

It used to work previously, but since december 2021, it no longer works on Fedora 35/36/37. It says 'No accounts', which is definitly not the case, as my iPhone can read them without issues from the same ubikey.

There have been numerous people complaining about this, but somehow it doesn't get resolved.
It can show the Yubikey serial number etc., but it won't show any accounts stored on the key. The key works fine on Windows 10.

Does what it should and does it better than other OTP authentication apps. Other reviewers often mentioned that the accounts stored on the Yubikey would't show up in the app. As stated in the Yubikey documentation make sure the pcscd service is installed and running.

sudo systemctl enable pcscd
sudo systemctl start pcscd

worked for me...

what a poor try for adding it to officail software repo for Clear Linux Project - need to manually kill process after appexit otherwise you can't open it again. 
Weird way to manage FIDO2/U2F access - no way that previosly set upped will work... tragicly useless.. 
and no CLI (ykman) at all - really?
It's not the latest version but this one is working without any problems on Ubuntu 22.04.
Works perfectly. Currently in a very good place.
I had to use the app image for awhile, NO LONGER! It now works in the flatpak without issue.
Works the same as the AppImage
summary: Works the same as the AppImage

description: The Flatpak worked well but is no longer working on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.3 (unsure about other 8.x releases). Yubico has recognized the issue and recommends using the AppImage or the Snap as they do not maintain the Flatpak.
summary: No longer working / not maintained by Yubico

description:
Honestly it look like an alpha version:
- The UI is ugly
- Animation are slow and laggy
- The app don't support HDPI screen so everything is small.
- No customisation settings ( every people on earth read number as group of 3...in some country it's by 2)

Now sometime the App break: 
- no way to came back to the Authenticator section.
- Sometime the app will not detect the key
- Sometime the app will only show some 2FA and the other will stay empty

So yeah think they have to invest into a testing and add auto Dark/light theme, customisation options, and most importantly make sure that the app work properly.
The app doesn't work properly. First time start after ubuntu login it works great but if you close the app it won't recognize the yubikey token anymore in current session.
